Department: Saw Swee Hock School Of Public Health
ModuleDescription:
Exposure to environmental hazards such as toxins,
chemicals, biological agents, noise and radiation are
oftentimes unavoidable, especially in the workplace
setting.
This module covers basic concepts as well as specific
topics on Toxicology and Industrial Hygiene that are
relevant to current occupational and public health practice.
Emphasis will be on the approach to major environmental
and occupational toxins and hazards. Case studies will be
used to allow participants the opportunity to practise
effective problem-solving skills.
Preclusion:
CO5305 Industrial Hygiene
CO5306 Public Health Toxicology
